subproject.description:
The concept of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is not sufficiently developed in Montenegro. Only a small number of companies have a clearly defined CSR policy and usually the application of this concept is related to ad hoc donations for individuals, civil society organizations and public institutions, but not to sponsorship. Accordingly, internal dimension of CSR, which primarily considers the concern for employees, as well as environmental protection and socially responsible conduct of companies, becomes neglected. Therefore, it is expected and important to consider social responsibility of companies, which declare themselves as being such, by conducting researches and taking into account this dimension of CSR as well.
Communication and cooperation between companies and non-governmental organizations (NGOs) is not at the satisfactory level. According to both parties, a main cause for this situation is lack of confidence. Companies mainly criticize a lack of transparency in the work of NGOs, while NGOs believe that companies generally do not have enough sensibility for the needs of communities where they conduct their business operations. Furthermore, the examples demonstrate that there are much more implemented partner projects and investments by business sector when public institutions are involved.
The level of information about the concept of CSR among the mass media is not at a satisfactory level as well.
A key problem for the long-term development of the concept of CSR in Montenegro is lack of involvement of relevant institutions at the national level in the process of creating a favourable environment for development of the concept of CSR . Certain law regulations regarding donations from the companies for the activities of common good are not stimulating enough for the companies in general. Additionally, a government body which would continuously work on promotion and development of the concept of CSR in Montenegro does not exist .
It is evident that the increase of knowledge and level of information of all sectors in Montenegrin society about the concept of CSR is necessary if we want to overcome the prejudices about each other and to jointly start with intense activities for improvement of living conditions of all members in the Montenegrin society. Countries from the region – Serbia, Macedonia, Bosnia and Herzegovina can serve as a good model to follow .
The UN Global Compact is a strategic policy initiative for businesses that are committed to aligning their operations and strategies with ten universally accepted principles in the areas of human rights, labour, environment and anti-corruption. By doing so, business, as a primary agent driving globalization, can help ensure that markets, commerce, technology and finance advance in ways that benefit economies and societies everywhere.
Never before have the objectives of the international community and the business world been so aligned. Common goals, such as building markets, combating corruption, safeguarding the environment and ensuring social inclusion, have resulted in unprecedented partnerships and openness among business, government, civil society, labour and the United Nations. Many businesses recognize the need to collaborate with international actors in the current global context where social, political and economic challenges (and opportunities) — whether occurring at home or in other regions — affect companies as never before.
